title: Folders and Migrating from 32 Bit to 64 bit vesion
content:
I have a Thunderbird 32 bit version 128 running on Windows 10 Pro. 16 GB memory with 512 GB storage

I first like to know if I upgrade to 64 bit version of Thunderbird. Beside doing a backup of the 32 bit version what be the best way to backup. I planning on using onedrive to backup the data. Any suggestions there is there extension anyone can recommend?

Can I upgrade to 64 bit version without having to do anything?

The second thing please reference the image attached to this thread. As you noticed there a lot of folders in INBOX and in Drafts. I tried moving them but seems they are not relocating. I even tried copying to them to another folder.

Should I try upgrading thunderbird to 32 bit first? There so many folders and subfolders that I don't think thunderbird can handle moving that much data.

The person who setup this application does not have any computer background at all.

I appreciate anyone who can assist with this issue.

title: Mozilla Thunderbird not matching time format of the OS
content:
I'm running Thunderbird 140.0.1 (64-bit) on Windows 10. The problem is Thunderbird is showing wrong format. My system's sets are: Short date: dd.MM.yyyy Long date: dd MMMM yyyy 'г.' Short time: HH:mm Long time: HH:mm:ss

Thunderbird's language is set to English (US). And it shows times as: 1:00 AM, 2:00 PM etc. Tried to change it to en_GB, did nothing at all. Changing it to ru_RU affects the time format, but interface goes Russian which is unwanted.

Please help to fix it. It's crucial for me to have 24h format as otherwise I cannot use mail/calendar because it's misleading.

title: After update date/time format wrong and cannot change
content:
After accidental change to Thunderbird 140.0.1esr (64-bit) all date/time display changed to American format (7/16/2025, 12:55 PM) where it used to be the settings of my machine (Win10 64 bit, language English, region Netherlands): short date dd-MM-yyyy long date ddddd dd-MM-yyyy short time HH:mm long time HH:mm:ss I tried overriding the setting using the config editor and inserted ntl.date_time.pattern_override.date_short and ntl.date_time.pattern_override.time_short, restarted TB which promptly lost the new settings (not saved). Also the Message List Display Options defaults to Cards view after restart, even after changing to Table view.

Please help!
